comment.author: 34118194@N00
comment._content:
A big thanks to the "state library of New South Wales" for taking the considerable time and expense for sharing these fantastic images with the world.

Thank you!

Joel

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: Our pleasure.  We are really glad you  are enjoying them.
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Yes also thank you for sharing these images. Would you have any idea in what hotel this bar was located. Those were the days when all you did to clean the bar was to hose it out.

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content:
Dear dunedoo

When the Hood ii collection was catalogued, all available information on the photographs was included in the Catalog record, so sorry, we don't know. Hood may have taken the photos for the brewery (Tooths or Reschs), or for the magazine Building, held in the State Library.
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 23622893@N07
comment._content: Hi, I'm 99% sure this is a picture of the hotel on the corner of Flinders and South Dowling Street. It used to be called the Palace Hotel, now called the Local Taphouse.  They have renovated now, but when it was the Palace Hotel the bar was the same.

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Pubs of Australia, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
